review_blob:
Decent session IPA. Very aromatic, lemons on the noise. Bright solventy hop flavor with a good and firm bitterness. Thin body, like most session. Pretty good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Citrusy hop aroma. For a Brett beer it's very malty and rich. Peppery rye like flavor too. Very little sour flavor. A little of the "barnyard" stuff going on though. A pretty good pale but not what I was expecting or wanting with "Brett" in the tittle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

All the elements of a typical IPA are here. Uniqueness in a cedar hop flavor and marijuana like aroma. Done well to feature the equinox hops. Would drink again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Harvest Single Hop IPA - Equinox

review_blob:
A great peppery IPA. There is rye in this and it really comes through. A grainy, bready, peppery IPA with a good cereal-y malt background. Slightly chewy malt background. Balanced. Good sessionable IPA that still retains great hop and malt flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Good example of a double IPA that is about flavor and balance and not about "destroying, ruining, etc" your palate or being "extreme." Nice notes of citrus and rosemary in the flavor and aroma. A little cloudy in appearance, nice copper color. Very drinkable for a double.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
